intro: Osmorhiza obtusa, commonly known as blunt-fruited sweetroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Osmorhiza obtusa thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
